Name: Good hotel, friendly staff
Review Content: I stayed here at the start of my Namibia safari and on the last day of my tour.  It's located outside the city centre but they have a free shuttle service which operates every 30 mins, taking people to and from the centre.  I found this very useful.  To get to the hotel from the airport I got one of those minivans - 100 NAM dollars. The room that I stayed in on the first night was very very big - 2 double beds and a sofa bed.  The decor is a bit dated and the carpet looks old, but I didn't feel uncomfortable there.  The bathroom was also a bit dated and the light bulb in there kept flashing when I turned it on.  The room I stayed in on my last night in Namibia was a bit smaller but again, it was comfortable.The hotel has several restaurants.  I had a buffet dinner at the Welwitschia restaurant on the first night.  Good selection of food.  The buffet breakfast, which is included, had a fine selection of cereals and hot meals - the crepes were excellent!  On my last night there I tried their Grill Room and had an excellent calamari steak.I would highly recommend this hotel as a place to start/end your adventure in Namibia.  The staff are friendly and the services are excellent.

Name: Not willing to take any responsibility!
Review Content: My wife and I as well as my mother were guests in your hotel on our final night of our annual Namibia holiday in rooms 59 and 60 from November 9th toNovember 10th 2012..This being our final night I enquired at the safari hotel reception about the possibility of a shuttle to the airport the next day as well as the exact time of departure of the SAA noon flight. According to schedule shown to me my Sergio the departure time of this flight was 1.20 PM. As I had in the back of my mind the departure time of 12:20 PM I went to the safari court reception to use the business center and check the departure time again online on our flight schedule. This  again said 12:20 PM. With this information I approached the Safari Court reception which again told me the flight would leave at 1:20 PM. This was confirmed by an elderly old white gentleman with reddish white hair working for the safari hotels, as he overheard my conversation with the reception. He explained the difference in time due to the change from summer time to winter time in Germany. This seemed plausible to me, as he said that he has returned from Germany last week and had had a similar experience. Furthermore he laughed when I jokingly said, I would sue him, if he was wrong.Unfortunately when the three of us arrived at Windhuk  Airport at 11.55 AM we had to find out, that the SAA Flight did indeed leave at 12:20 PM and the gates were already closed and the machine was on the runway. Not even my star alliance gold status was able to change anything as the machine was overbooked. I therefore had to buy three additional British airways tickets so that we luckily were still able to catch our flight from Johannesburg to Germany.From the airport I called Sergio as well as Francis of your staff to complain about this misinformation of Safari Hotels which cost me over ND 6.000,00. They both once again confirmed that according to their schedule the flight time should have been 1:20 PM and were shocked that this was not correct. Francis agreed with me that on behalf of Safari Hotels it was luck that only the three of us were affected and that we were able to get seats on the BA flight. The disaster could have been much bigger, if a larger group was effected or/ and if the intercontinental flights would have been missed.As safari hotels was recommended to me as a hotel of high international standard and the service and quality we experienced during our stay only confirmed this, there was no reason for me to have any doubts about the information I received from both receptions. All above is cited trom the letter I sent them. The only reaction I got was: This is all your own (my) problem, we are not responsible at all, not even on a goodwill basis!Wonder how other hotels of international reputation would have reacted!

Name: Very Disappointing stay!

Long story short, we got interleading rooms to accommodate our family (3 children and two adults). Upon check in, the wrong room had been made up and wrong keys given to us (no surprise there as the front lady staff we found was just in another world) and the rooms were not properly cleaned. Beds made but the cleaning standards close to zero! The restaurant staff very friendly and professional especially Justina, chef also excellent but in dining service very pathetic in that it took ages for food to arrive even despite the assurance that it would arrive within 30mins on all days. Another long story short, this hotel has a sewer stench in many places on the property. Outside, inside and this was very odd! Finally, how do you have one side of hotel fully operational and where guests are sleeping, it's totally deserted with a security guard being the only person to provide service and a note at reception saying "call this number if you need service!" I was very disappointed with our stay and we have had to find alternative accommodation elsewhere. Very disappointing for such a high standard hotel. Goodness. Please re-train them front office staff esp the lady we found upon check in and let staff be professional to all guests whether white or black. We definitely felt the nonsense segregation and treatment. Not worth our hard earned cash to waste here at all!

The bathrooms aren't great and because there's only a shower, there's no place to hang up hand washing.  (I saw wet socks hanging out of windows.) The restaurant has a large but monotenous buffet although you can walk to the nicer hotel on the grounds for a slightly better meal.

Name: Mediocre, if not sub-par
Review Content: Preface: This 3-star Safari Hotel is located adjacent to its more modern 4-star sister Safari Court as well as the Safari Conference Centre, all within a fenced compound. So bear in mind that this review is only meant for the 3-star motel and not the others. First Impressions: Having spent the better of two weeks camping, I was ready for any place that had concrete instead of dirt under my feet. Imagine my pleasant surprise upon entering the lobby of Hotel Safari. Marbled floors, elegant decor, rich fabric. Quite classy, I thought. And then, imagine my utter disappointment when we were told to personally carry our luggage 50 meters away to the group of rooms set up like a 1950's drive-in strip motel. Yeah, that feeling. Apparently, our tour operator booked us into the standard budget rooms for one night.Pros: For the business types, the conference centre is just next door. There is free airport shuttle, free WiFi, swimming pool, complimentary breakfast at its on-site restaurant and a souvenir shop. For extended internet use, one may ask to use the handful of computer terminals over at the Safari Court's business centre. Overall, service is friendly, courteous and helpful.Cons: Unfortunately, every positive feature of this motel has its letdowns. Location is not its best asset. It is quite far from the Windhoek city centre as well as the international airport. Although free shuttle is available, it is only to the nearby domestic airport and only until 6pm. Our rooms, though clean, appear dated and tired. The free WiFi is restricted to 2 hours and different passwords are handed out on slips of paper.  (I went around this restriction by collecting several access passwords until I had a bunch.) The pool can get quite cold!!! The souvenir shop is small and has limited inventory. The breakfast is forgettable. Verdict: This hotel has the potential to be a very nice one, if only management had bothered to upgrade, if not refurbish, it. I'm not a fussy traveller but, if you only use the hotel to sleep in, it does the job. Just lower your expectations. It is adequate for a few day's stay but, for longer stays, there are better accommodations closer to the city centre.

Name: Der absoulte Top Urlaub
Review Content: Das Camp ist hervorragend, die achteckigen Zelte sind bestens ausgestattet. Hier gibt es einen fest gemauerten Waschtisch und gemauerte und getrennte DU und WC. Steckdosen, Schreibtisch, Moskitonetz, Terasse mit 2 Stühlen und Öllampe. Im Zelt gibt es eine Taschenlampe (da ab ca. 23. 00 Uhr-05. 00 Uhr kein Strom!) und eine Trillerpfeife für Notfälle. Außerdem gibt es einen Klingelknopf, damit man bei Dunkelheit und für Gepäckservice einen Massai rufen kann, dieser bringt die Gäste sicher zum Hauptgebäude. Das Camp ist unter deutscher Leitung, der Service ist super. Das Restaurant bot abends ein 4Gang Wahlmenue von sehr guter Qualität, das Frühstücksbuffet war umfangreich und ebenfalls sehr gut. Es gibt auch richtige Zimmer in Bungalows und neuerdings einen Pool mit Wellnessbereich. All dies ist direkt in der Wildnis (Steppe), ohne Zaun direkt neben den Warzenschweinen, Impalas und Erdhörnchen.

Name: Excellent Mid-Market Choice ~ Especially Business Rooms
Review Content: The service at reception was smooth and efficient, if a little abrupt. The main Lobby was modern and smart, with seating both inside and outside reception and a small hotel gift shop.We booked a 'Business' room which was only marginally more expensive than the Standard room rate. It was situated on the first floor of a block adjoining (opposite) the main building that housed reception. The room was brand new, having only recently undergone complete refurbishment, was large and fitted to a high quality. Superb bathroom with all new fittings, shower and large accomodating bath. Tea & Coffee making facilities, Fridge/Mini-Bar, satellite TV, individually controlled Air- Conditioning (a little noisy).The hotel had three main restaurants and several bars. We ate in the main a la carte restaurant (which also offered a buffet choice) and although the service was a little slow, the staff were friendly, courteous and the food & wine was excellent ~ and reasonable, Namibian prices! The buffet breakfast also offered a wide range (our room rate was inclusive of breakfast). We stayed only one night for a post-Safari stop, before departing for the UK. We used the Swimming Pool and Beer Garden bar which were well organised. The main road passes the hotel quite near to the swimming pool, but road noise was never a problem.You can also use the facilities of the sister hotel ~ the Hotel Safari Court (4*) , which is within the same grounds ~ although we never had time to try these and the hotel also runs a free mini-bus service into the centre of Windhoek, approx. 8-10 mins away which was efficiently run. We could thoroughly recommend this excellent 3* property and would suggest the small extra for the refurbished 'Business' rooms is worth paying.

Name: UNA BUONA BASE
Review Content: Ho trascorso due notti all'inizio ed alla fine del nostro tour in Namibia presso questo hotel che mi è parso buono e con un ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo.So bene che in Namibia esistono hotel e lodge di qualità elevata, ma questa struttura ha tutto quello che può servire ad un viaggiatore che bada alla sostanza.L'hotel è costituito da due strutture, una di categoria 3* ed una di categoria 4*.Noi abbiamo alloggiato nel 3 stelle e questo il mio giudizio:la hall è molto accogliente con personale gentile e disponibileLe camere sono molto grandi, con arredamento un pò datato ma funzionale e sono dotate di aria condizionata, bollitore per tè e caffè e televisore (senza canali italiani).I bagni sono buoni e puliti. Le camere sono sistemate in bungalow tutti a piano terra e se avete l'auto la potete parcheggiare proprio davanti alla porta d'ingresso.Per la cena, si hanno a disposizione due ristoranti: quello del 4* stelle ha un ottimo buffet a prezzo fisso (circa 20 Euro con bevande) con carne, pesce e antipasti a volontà. Il 3* stelle ha un buffet altrettanto valido ma un pò meno ricco.L'hotel è abbastanza distante dal centro, anche se è collegato con una navetta gratuita con numerose corse durante il giorno.Dispone anche di una bella piscina, anche se non molto grande, ma molto ben ambientata con prato e lettini prendisole.Considerato che comunque a Windhoek non si deve dedicare oltre due notti la sistemazione è più che valida

Name: Much to be improved
Review Content: The Safari Hotel is not an expensive hotel, but it is dreary and much in need of freshening up. For the sentimental, it does offer many flashback's to the 70s with plenty of brown and orange decor and even a headboard mounted radio with preprogrammed dial for changing stations. Receptionists are lacking in enthusiasm and once you have your room key – attached to a super-sized fob – it's across the busy roadway to your likely distant room. With no obvious pedestrian crossing marked across the road, and not much evidence of speed regulation within the hotel precinct, you will not get to your accommodation feeling relaxed. The sheets were clean and the bed comfortable, and the room large enough not to feel cramped. Floor space economized upon in the bathroom, where there is minimal space to move between the shower, basin and toilet. Showering also requires quite a bit of maneuvering as the worn shower head is very much multidirectional. In general, meals in Namibia are good to excellent, but dinner at the nearby Safari Court – ostrich stroganoff – was expensive and poorly prepared. Try your luck with a careful selection at the buffet instead. Breakfast the Safari Hotel was pretty average - oily frying area to be avoided, and no choice of some basics like skim milk to go with the cereals. Anyhow, it wouldn't take more than some good advice and some serious commitment to improve on the experience.

Name: Nicht unbedingt empfehlenswert
Review Content: Das Safari Hotel liegt am südlichen Stadtrand von Windhuk, in deutlicher Sicht- und Hörweite des Flughafens Eros. Das erste uns zugewiesene Zimmer haben wir direkt zurückgegeben, weil es so unglaublich dreckig war, auf dem Tablett mit den Kaffee- und Teezubereitungsmöglichkeiten befand sich benutztes Geschirr. So etwas geht gar nicht und zeigt, wie schlampig das Housekeeping in diesem Hotel ist. Generell war das Personal dort sehr unfreundlich (bis auf die Rezeptionisten) und grüßte die Gäste prinzipiell nicht, ebenfalls ein absolutes No-Go. Das zweite uns zugewiesene Zimmer war dann auch nicht besser: ein verschlissenes Sofa, auf dem sich noch eingetrocknete Käse- und Brötchenkrümel der Vorgänger befanden, aber wenigstens - zumindest optisch - saubere Tassen. Die abgewohnten Buche-Furnier-Sperrholzmöbel und die löchrige, befleckte Tagesdecke auf dem Bett trug auch nicht gerade zur Verbesserung des Gesamteindrucks bei. Die Zimmertür war leider etwas zu klein für den Türrahmen und wies rundum einen ca. 2 - 3 cm breiten Spalt auf, was bei nächtlichen Minusgraden und ohne Heizung nicht angenehm ist. Heißes Wasser gab es nicht, bestenfalls lauwarmes. Duschgel ebenfalls Fehlanzeige, aber ein Stückchen Handwaschseife war vorhanden. Die eine Nacht haben wir ausgehalten, aber es war schon sehr schade ums Geld. Das Positive an diesem Hotel waren der im Preis inkludierte Shuttleservice in die Stadt und das Frühstücksbuffet, welches neben Eiern, Speck, Würstchen, Joghurt, Müsli, Säften und einem wunderbar köstlichen Brot auch Quiche, Crepes und süßes Kleingebäck im Angebot hatte.

Name: Very Accommodating Staff, Pleasant Grounds and Rooms
Review Content: We spent 10 nights at the Safari Hotel, 3 before a booked 5-day trip/safari and 7 after. We found the staff to be very helpful with all requests. They loaned us a converter plug, they stored our luggage in a locked area while we went on our safari, they got taxi rides for us and we used the shuttle to get to town several times.They also let us switch rooms our second stay when the wifi wouldn't work. The only complaint is about the wifi. You have to get small slips of paper from the desk with codes on them to get on the wifi. The code only lasts so long so you are constantly putting in a new code, if you are choosing to get online at all. Sometimes it didn't work at all. We appreciated the free hotel shuttle that goes to two malls and the city center. They were prompt in picking us up and it was easy to use. There are two restaurants on the premises, one in the Safari Hotel and one in the Safari Court Hotel. There is a nice buffet breakfast in both places but you can only eat at the one at your own hotel. You can go to either for lunch or dinner but at times the Welwitschia at the Safari Hotel was closed. It seemed the Acacia at the Safari Court Hotel was a little more upscale but I think they both served the same things. The lunch and dinner buffets were delicious and varied with lots of different appetizers, salads, breads, dutch oven meats and vegetable dishes and desserts. There are two pool areas and I believe you can use either, not matter which hotel you stay at. The conference center is really the crowning jewel of this property - the building has wide hallways with counters to serve drinks and snacks. The conference rooms are huge with great video and audio systems. The reception area in that building accommodated signage and a big area for checking in for the conference. There's another building that is more of a hug tent that was used for a mixer - the food was nice every time there was a big party for conference goers. It says a lot about a hotel's kitchen staff when delicious food can be cranked out for 400+ people. Hot foods were hot and cold foods were cold. We would stay at this hotel again in the future if our travel plans took us there. Some reviewers have said it's old and dated. That didn't bother us. It was nice and the people who took care of us were nice too. It was an enjoyable stay.

Он идеально подходит для тех, кто по прилету в Африку хочет немного перевести дух, а на следующий день уже отправляться на изучение Намибии в более туристические места.Отель оформлен достаточно сдержанно. Еда, как нам показалась, была среднего уровня, но более, чем приемлемой за те деньги, что они просят в замен.Номер был явно не новым, но чистым и аккуратным. Большие кровати, телевизор, кондиционер. Единственный неприятный момент - еле теплая вода в душе начала идти только минут через 10 его использования. Чтобы было очень неудобно и немного подпортило общее впечатление.Отель однозначно рекомендую, но как "транзитный" вариант

Frühstück und Abendessen nichts Besonderes und nicht einmal schön präsentiert. Swimmingpool sehr schmutzig und gar nicht einladend. Lieber ins Safari Court gehen und den Mehrpreis in Kauf nehmen.

Name: Less than satisfactory
Review Content: Too expensive for what you get. Cold shower - no hot water for entire stay (during winter), outdated heater in room so cold room was cold, no bedside lamps in working order, warn toilet seat (wooden splinters), safe in room did not function, cooked but cold breakfast... if you knew what you were eating. No one to serve you at the bar. We left wondering about cleanliness.Rather find a small B&B for the same price, where the owners will take more care.

Name: Good upmarket hotel
Review Content: Good upmarket hotel with well-appointed rooms, no need for mozzie nets, drinkable tap water and good wifi. Good cooked breakfast.  Porters unable to access room to collect luggage without guest's key.  Otherwise good staff.

Name: Right Next To The Airport
Review Content: With it's location, the hotel appears to cater mainly to the corporate/business traveler. I would class the room I received as barely 3 Star due to it's aged decor, tiny showering facilities and air conditioner that barely moved air, let alone chilled it.Dining facilities were great as were the staff we encountered for the most part. Two points that stood out however was that none of our group of travelers received any guidance as to the hotels facilities when checking in and the barman's knowledge at 9PM regarding such stables as Harvey Wallbangers, G&T, White Russians, Cosmopolitan stopped at pouring a beer - bizarre.

Name: Unpleasantly Surprised
Review Content: Checking in at reception you are welcomed by modern warm surroundings with friendly staff. You then make your way down to the "cell blocks". Upon entering the "cell", although very spacious, you immediately time warp to the 70's & feel like you on "That 70's Show". The burglar bars, ink stamped pillow cases & a broken shower door that literally locks you inside the shower don't exactly create a sense of comfort & at almost N$1000 a night it is rather disappointing.I would definitely not stay here again, there are more luxurious places to stay for the same price.
Date: Date of stay: June 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Just average
Review Content: This hotel has seen better days. Furniture, carpets, bathrooms are fairly run-down and in need of renovations. Our room was a bit smelly, too. WiFi often not functional in the rooms, computer system needed to be constantly rebooted. Location a bit out of the way and not exactly convenient to downtown Windhoek. The cash machine in the lobby was out of cash. Front desk staff was not particularly friendly or helpful and most spoke and understood English very poorly. However, most of the wait staff was friendly and happy to help. Bar man refused to serve me at the bar when I went to fetch a drink to take outside to the pool.  He insisted I order at the table, so I had to wait 10 min until I was able to find a waiter (who was charming, however).  Breakfast was adequate for what it is. I cannot recommend this hotel and would not go back unless I had no other options.
Date: Date of stay: March 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nella media
Review Content: Ho soggiornato una notte al "Safari Hotel" al termine del mio viaggio in Namibia. Si trova appena fuori Windhoek, è infatti indispensabile un mezzo per raggiungere il centro della città; l'albergo mette a disposizione delle navette gratuite, ma consiglio di informarsi bene sugli orari (l'ultima navetta del giorno, almeno il giorno in cui c'ero io, era alle 14 circa...per cui al ritorno è stato necessario un taxi). Struttura grande, con camere spaziose, ma tutto piuttosto vecchio... Buona la cena a buffet al ristorante dell'albergo (circa 150 dollari namibiani, escluse le bevande). Wifi gratis! Nel complesso, niente di particolare...ma come punto di partenza o di arrivo per un viaggio in Namibia, va benissimo!

Name: Un hôtel de grande ville
Review Content: Dommage que cet hôtel soit excentré, sinon les chambres sont spacieuses, le jardin piscine agréable.Ensemble est propre et bien entretenu. Le buffet est moyen, le petit plus c'est la plancha : vous choisissez vos aliments le cuistot les cuit, joli petit déjeuner;

Name: Due notti al Safari Hotle
Review Content: E' un hotel adatto unicamente per pernottare all'arrivo e al ritorno per un viaggio in Namibia. Lo scorso anno avevamo soggiornato al Safari Court, sempre nello stesso complesso, 4 stelle, ma la differenza non si nota granchè. Servizio scadente, pulizia appena decente, colazione abbastanza soddisfacente, camere ampie, il tutto in un ambiente decisamente decadente. Il centro e l'aereoporto si raggiungono facilmente con i bus navetta a disposizione dei clienti, se non si ha una propria vettura. Ripeto, per dormire una notte può andare, ma non oltre

Name: Excellent mid-range hotel with good facilities
Review Content: The Safari Hotel is great for a couple of nights stay at the beginning or end of your trip (especially if you have been camping!). The staff are very friendly and helpful and reception always well staffed. Free safety deposit box service, lockable wardrobe section in your room and plenty of security. I was travelling alone and it all felt very safe and friendly, unlike some of the guest houses which people on my tour felt were not so safe. There is a decent sized pool with plenty of sun loungers and a pool bar service for drinks and snacks. Couple of nice restaurants also which are fairly reasonably priced. I stayed in the business class room which was spacious and had all the comforts you would expect from this class of hotel and much appreciated air con! It's also easy to extend your check out time and arrange for airport transfers. I made good use of the free shuttle service which runs in and out of Windhoek centre every 30 mins and only takes about 5-10 mins to get there. Definitely don't let the fact this is not in the centre put you off, it's cheap and easy to arrange taxis to restaurants etc at night and even the places closer to the centre recommend taking taxis after about 8pm anyway. Recommend this one for a well priced hotel with good facilities and excellent service.
Date: Date of stay: February 2008This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Need to improve
Review Content: They change our rooms without any prior arrangements and we just have to except it. The room standards for what you pay is not good value for money. Their breakfast were great in the past but cutting back on the variety make it just another breakfast. Service at reception is still slow after so many years. The banquet service was just plain poor. No other words to use. I will call the staff arrogant.

Name: Safari Hotel Windhoek....not bad
Review Content: We stayed at Safari Hotel Windhoek from 11- 13 May 2019 and then again on 17 May 2019. My first stay was however a lot better than the second. The hotel was ok, nothing special. My room was clean and functional and breakfast buffet served from 6.30 am was real good. However, the facilities in the rooms were dated and need an update. For instance, they still had a cathode ray TV. For my second stay, the electric kettle didn'work at all and the service was poor generally. However, if you looking for a safe, affordable,no frills hotel in Windhoek, Safari Hotel is a good choice.

Name: Outdated & Expired
Review Content: I will not be thanking my travel agent for this reservation.While the staff are friendly and helpful and the in house dining good, the good size room was probably once upon a time one of the better hotels on the block, the current state of the rooms are just to dowdy and outdated at best. With the dark wood furniture, eighties light fixtures, and carpet that is just 'blah', nothing impresses me in the room.The TV is simply prehistoric and the adjoining bathroom pathetic.Somebody please update the entire bathroom as mould round the bathtub, is making it's rounds.Only consolation are the clean white towels and sheets, and comfy bed which were the saving grace. I would change hotels if I had more then a nights stay in Windhoek or alternatively book a stay in a nice modern apartment hosted by a 'Superhost' and there a so many attractive apartments and rooms available on the home sharing app, Airbnb, that would cost less then spend money on a outdated hotel. If there are modern and updated homes out in Windhoek there is no reason why this hotel cannot upgrade themselves to the current century.Breakfast is basic at best.Someone donate a toaster please!WiFi is same a most of Namibia but the internet expires daily with a new complicating password to renew daily.Too depressing rooms to take any nice pictures, I rather not, thanks!If you absolutely must stay here, I suggest you request for an upgraded room in the new wing.

Name: Very disappointing
Review Content: Accommodation was very ordinary didn't find the staff friendly .We got dropped of at the shopping centre and the shuttle bus driver said he would be back in one hour and he didn't turn up we had to catch a taxi back to our hotel.The shower was just warm and the drain was blocked .The only good thing was the food in the restaurant it was delicious but again service was ordinary all they need to do is smile .

Name: Lodge and Rooms
Review Content: I stayed twice, once at the beginning of a trip and once at the end. My first stay was in a lodge or motel style room. It's clean, spacious, comfortable. The second stay was in the business rooms - these are more luxurious - carpeted rooms in a multi-storey block, sockets to suit uk plugs, wifi in the room, and generally a better standard or repair. The communal areas are well presented. Good breakfast buffet. The wifi system is a bit of a nuisance. You need a free code for every 50mb fir every device which means collecting multiple bits of paper from reception with endless codes. However, it is possible to get connected for basic communication, if not photo uploading.

Name: Für einen kurzen Aufenthalt in Ordnung
Review Content: Unser Zimmer war sehr abgewohnt, vor allem die Badezimmer benötigen dringend eine Renovierung. Das Abendessen (Buffet), sah zunächst super aus, war geschmacklich aber das schlechteste Essen, was ich in 12 Tagen Namibia konsumiert habe. Das Frühstück hingegen war Top und bietet eine tolle Auswahl. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Wlan funktioniert hier auch in den Zimmern, was aber das einzige Schmackhafte an den Zimmern ist. Wir haben in den Nebengebäuden gewohnt mit Aussicht auf einen "Garten" und eine Mauer. Der Flugplatz nebenan sorgt für einen unruhigen Schlaf.

Name: Unterkunft mit Motelcharakter, gutes Essen
Review Content: Unser Zimmer für eine Nacht lag am Rande des Hotelbereiches und hatte Parkplätze vor den Zimmern wei man es von Motels kennt. Am Nachmittag ist es manchmal durch Fluglärm laut, allerdings war es in der Nacht ruhig.Das Restaurant bietet Buffet oder A La Carte und kann empfohlen werden. Das Essen schmeckte uns dort sehr gut. Service im Restaurant wie auch an der Rezenption sehr freundlich und behilflich. Torten und Kuchen sind sehr lecker und üppig.

Name: Nie wieder
Review Content: Wir waren am Ende einer Rundreise mit der Gruppe dort für 1 Nacht. Länger hätte man es auch nicht ausgehalten. Wir wurden in einem abgelegenen Trakt untergebracht (Unser Zimmer: 16A). Einrichtung aus den 70er-Jahren des letzten Jahrtausends. Muffiger Geruch. Badezimmer nicht sehr sauber und rudimentär ausgestattet. In der Dusche funktionierte ausserdem der Abfluss nicht, so dass man nach kurzer Zeit in einem See stand. Fenster sind vergittert, die Bahntrasse führt direkt vorbei, startende und landende Flugzeuge in greifbarer Nähe. Unserer Beobachtung nach wurden  Zimmer in diesem Trakt auch als Personalzimmer genutzt. Ein unschöner Abschluss einer schönen Reise.

Name: Dated and worn out, but with (mostly) friendly service
Review Content: I stayed at Hotel Safari for one night during a business trip to Windhoek. I'm afraid it wasn't the best experience.First, so. many. cats. Stray cats everywhere. They feed stray cats (see photo) which has its benefits in keeping other undesirable creatures away, but also, eew. The room itself was rather dated. You could tell that they had made every effort to clean it as best they could, but there comes a time when a serious refurbishment is needed. This time has come for Hotel Safari. This time came for Hotel Safari a while ago!The televisions are old CRT-type TVs. The TV was also very unclear. The bed linens were clean but very, very worn (see photos). The linens also had the hotel name stamped on them which made me think of a correctional institution (at least that's how they look on TV), but who knows, maybe threadbare sheet theft is a thing in Windhoek.The bathroom was a challenge. It was just so antiquated! I had to force myself into the shower and it was a most unpleasant experience.You should not step out of a shower feeling ickier than when you stepped in. And for some inexplicable reason the towels (which looked very clean I must say) smelt of roast lamb.I had a drink in the hotel bar and dinner in the restaurant. The service in the bar was strange. The barmen and waiters walked past me for a good 15 minutes until I managed to catch one's eye to get service. The drinks list was very limited with their best wines not being very good at all (although to be positive this meant that prices were very reasonable).The dinner was a disappointment. The buffet cost N$175 per person but I'd be hard-pressed to see how they could charge more than N$50 for that meal! Service in the restaurant was atrocious. Our waiter disappeared for long stretches of time; this was clearly a result of poor training and not the waiter's fault.Even though I've painted a very grim picture in this review I must point out that the service was very friendly. The check-in and check-out processes were efficient, and the housekeeping staff were very friendly.

Name: Gutes Hotel direkt neben Flugplatz Eros
Review Content: Die Hotelanlage in Windhoek ist gross und für afrikanische Verhältnisse überraschend gut. Name: A Good choice for business trip to Windhoek
Review Content: Stayed in a business room for 3 nights. Room was large and clean with a good size bathroom with bath. Generally everything of a good standard, although there was rip in the net curtains, a broken bin lid and the large key ring and stiff lock made getting into the room a bit of a noisy struggle.Bought internet cards from reception which worked in the room, although fairly slow and did not always log off correctly wasting paid minutes.Reasonable pool, but water heavy with chemical and no shade for the loungers, although there are tables and chairs under thatched open-sided “huts”.Staff friendly and very helpful, but generally slower waiter service than in the US or Europe.Breakfast buffet style with reasonable hot choice, but no fresh fruit and limited selection of cold meats and cheese.Taxis easily arranged by reception into town.

Name: Great option, very friendly staff
Review Content: We stayed here in late December for a 1 night stopover between Cape Town and London.The hotel suits the formula for this type. Rooms were spacious and clean. Air-conditioning worked, but was a bit louder than we would've liked. (Although not loud enough to stop us using it. Bathroom had separate bath and shower (although this may be dependant on which room you're allocated) which were both clean. Staff were very friendly, customer service was great. We were given a welcome basket on the ocassion of our anniversary, we were allowed to checkout after 17h00, etc. etc.The hotel is under renovation, try and get one of the newly renovated rooms. Upon arrival our 'first room' had a plumbing problem and we were moved to another. These things happen - the mark of a good hotel is how they are dealt with. There was no fuss or problem in moving us, so the hotel scores for customer service. We even got upgraded to a slightly smarter room in the deal.The hotel has a pool in the complex. There is a also a bar and restaurant. Breakfast was pretty formulaic for this type of hotel - nothing to get excited about but enough to get the day going.Location of the hotel complex is okay, it's on the outskirts of town. I guess most people will have a hired car as that is the nature of Namibia. The hotel is about a 10m drive from the centre of Windhoek. They also run a shuttle service to the centre of town which we used when we didn't feel like driving ourselves. This was clean and reliable so no problems here.All in all, we were very happy and would likely stay here again. Value in terms of space and service relative to rates (when paying in £) is incomparable to UK hotels so for tourists paying in strong currencies used to European hotels and rates, you'll likely find this a great option offering a high class of accommodation for what seems like very little.

Name: Reasonable value for 3 star establishment
Review Content: DISCLAIMER: Safari Hotels have two separate hotels at the location.  One is a three star and the other is a four star.  The former is called the Safari Hotel and the latter the Safari Court Hotel.  There is obviously a cost difference between the two but they do share various facilities so if you have budget constraints then go for the cheaper option.  It is OK but the rooms are a bit tired and in need of renovation.  Service is good and the hotel does have an excellent conference venue and nice bars and restaurants.  Next time I would stay in the Safari Court.

Name: Good place to stay
Review Content: We recently satayed at the Safari Hotel before and after an organised trip. Really helpful staff, lovely breakfast and good choice of evening meals at reasonable prices. We had different rooms but large and spacious on both occasions. The shuttle bus into town worked extremely well. We used the gym and swimming pool, all well organised. The hotel pre attanged transfers to and from the airport for us and a Township tour to Katatura which I had previously enquired about, thanks for a lovely stay

Name: Disappointing Experience
Review Content: Lukewarm water, poorly maintained rooms, dreadful service, lack of visible management, poor training of staff, lack of porters, and unhelpful receptionists sums up the Hotel Safari.  I am a cat lover but was quite disgusted to find a plethora of neglected cats and kittens around the rooms.  Visited the hotel a few years ago and it has definitely deteriorated since then.  The food, when it finally arrived, was good.  Breakfast wasn't bad but is it necessary to put scones, topped with jam and cream under warming lamps?  All in all, it was a very disappointing experience.

Name: A mediocre hotel/motel
Review Content: A warm welcome met us in the smart foyer of the Safari Hotel, which promised much for our stay there. However, amongst our large group we had mixed opinions about our overall night's stay. We were accommodated in motel style rooms, most of which were in clear need of some tlc and refurbishment. Two of our rooms had an overbearing odour of cigarette smoke. When we mentioned this to reception, we were told that housekeeping would be round later to sort it out. The smell was so bad, we ended up insisting that we be moved, and in fairness we were. However, we were moved to a room with a faulty kettle, a chain lock that was not usable and a sink that didn't drain well. It was quite noisy late at night, though that was due to certain guests and I can't blame the hotel for that (though perhaps the security might have encouraged the 3am game players to quieten down a little!?).The whole place just needed some care! That said, the pool was fine (but very cold) as was the bar. In the morning, it was a buffet breakfast, but it was not great. The food was fairly tasteless and there was not much of it. It was certainly the first time in Namibia where I was left disappointed by the food on offer.If you're staying in Windhoek, I'd suggest there are better places for the price (such as the Arebbusch Lodge).

La colazione è servita nella struttura centrale ed è abbondante e sufficientemente varia. Non consiglio questa struttura, è stata la mia peggiore esperienza in Namibia.

Name: Standards Have Dropped .......
Review Content: Sunday 07th July -The last time i stayed in the hotel safari was in May 2012 , after a long 11hour flight from London then. 8 hour delay in Joburg due to the misplacement of my bag .I arrived in Windhoek and an hours drive from the airport I arrived at the SH .Once again check-in was painless and the female receptionist was helpful and quick which was good after all the travelling and waiting around in airports all I wanted to do was have a long shower and relax .I was given a basement room which was big , with 2 big beds all for me .Rooms at the Safari are not cheap and the scuff / scratch marks on the walls were a bit of a let down .During my shower it was also disappointing that the ceiling and coveing was black with mould . This build up is down to poor cleaning standards but because I was in need of a good hot shower I carried on .My bed was comfy with clean sheets and bedding , later in the evening I ordered a egg-burger snack to my room while I was watching the wimbledon tennis highlights on the telly .The food arrived very plainly , no tray , just my burger and chips on a plate covered in cling film . The waiter / porter gave me my bill to sign and then pointed out the cost of the food and hinted on a tip ! ..... I pointed out to him the delivery cost of the plate that was also on the bill , i said that's your tip .After eating airport food I was looking forward to my burger it was ok but the bun was burnt which surprised me .......if you are preparing a meal and you burn it and you know it's not the best ......why give it to the customer ....Why !!!The next day on checking out I discussed the shower and food concerns with the receptionist and I left for a short trip offshore.Now lets fast forwards to yesterday Friday 12th July - Again I was staying overnight in the Safari and then the next day I was travelling to London via Joburg .This time I was given a similar double bed basement room identical to the one I had on Sunday , this room was clean , comfy bed and the shower ceiling and coving were gleaming white .I decided to have a meal in the restaurant the waiter explained there was a buffet service or I could go "a la carte" I fancied a nice T- bone steak with all the trimmings and a boat jug of black pepper sauce .I like my steak medium and juicy and I waited drooling for my meal , when it arrived it looked tasty then when I started cutting into the steak it was a struggle .Each mouthful was a struggle - tough to chew , tasteless and a poor quality of meat .Infact I couldn't eat it I had to remove the tasteless mess from my mouth .The waiter asked me was I enjoying my meal I said NO the steak is tough and chewy I said good steak is succulent and full of flavour and sadly this is well below standard.He never battered a eyelid , he never said I'm sorry about that .....and then nothing he just removed my plate .After about 5 mins the waiter gave me the bill for my meal to sign , this shocked me the main attraction to my meal was the steak and it was a poor cut of meat , no flavour and tough . The chief who cooked it must have known its wasn't the best bit of cooking he had done .......but after all this I was still given a bill for 105 N$ .I told the waiter I wasn't happy and in the morning I also told the receptionist .I would have been embarrassed to have given a bill to a unhappy paying customer .High standards are paramount in a restaurant , sadly maybe this was a one off but for me it wasn't just the steak that left a poor taste in my mouth .Yes the restaurant is clean and stylish but if the cooking and presenting of the food is below standard No amount of smiles from the waiters will make up for the poor food . Having a meal is a total experience if the food is poor that will be the only thing that will be remembered .

Name: Rather Not...
Review Content: Recently stayed in the Safari Hotel for a conference and was not impressed at all. Their reception area looks modern and clean and then I went to my room.... Carpets were dirty and smelled of dust, toilet didn't want to flush properly, shower wouldn't drain in the bath, taps were rusted and the cupboard was dirty. So I basically didn't even unpack my bag. Breakfast was fine, staff not always friendly. Conference room was set up badly and again the carpets smelled of dust. Staff weren't able to assit delegates with finding the conference room because they themselves had no idea we were even there! Lunch was terrible, one day offered only fish and rice with some carrot salad (I am allergic to fish and don't eat rice) I ended up having a little carrot salad as that was all that was available for me. The coffee and tea table were mostly left empty so we couldn't even enjoy that. Some staff were not friendly and others were. 3 horrible nights and I absolutely loathed them. I am sad to say I had a terrible experience here. Perhaps others would say different but I was absolutely disappointed and let down as this was my first time in Namibia.

Name: Help given quickly and efficiently when you really needed
Review Content: We would probably only give this hotel a Poor rating, or at best an Average rating expect for the fact that they really helped out when we needed them. We had checked into our room early afternoon on a Thursday, and already returned our hire vehicle, since we were joining a Nomad Africa Overland Tour departing from the hotel early the following morning. Thus we were without our own, private transport, when mid-afternoon my wife suddenly and unexpectedly required rapid medical attention. We immediately went to the hotel reception, who quickly arranged for their shuttle-bus driver, Silas, to drive us to a private hospital, where my wife was able to consult a doctor and be prescribed appropriate medication - thus allowing us to continue with our holiday uninterrupted. Silas also provided us with his mobile phone number so that we were able to call him when we were finished, for him to drive us back to our hotel. Silas was very kind and helpful, as were all the staff at the hotel reception - and we were not even charged for the shuttle bus drive to and from the hospital. Thank you very much Silas and Safari Hotel - we really appreciate your help when we most needed it.As for the rest - well the hotel is very dated (think early 1970s at latest) and our room was exceedingly run down. The desk was broken and the refrigerator did not work. There was a large opening in the middle of the head board of the bed, which clearly used to contain a built-in radio - the radio was no longer there but the hole was, as were the wires that used to connect to the radio. On the morning we left, we discovered that (despite running the hot water a very long time) there was no hot water, so had to take a cold shower (no time to call reception and ask them to attend to the problem).Dinner at hotel restaurant consisted of a self-service menu of not particularly exciting or tasty dishes, usually lukewarm at best; likewise for the breakfast buffet.Also note that the hotel is situated right next to the main take-off runway for the local airport (not to be confused with Windhoek International Airport which is located far out of town). Because of this, one can hear the noise of all the small planes as they taxi to the end of the runway, before accelerating for take-off.Personally, we would not choose this hotel again if we had an alternative, but note that they DO help you quickly and efficiently should you be unfortunate enough to need to see a doctor.

Name: Ruhig gelegenes, jedoch nicht zentrales Hotel in der Hauptstadt
Review Content: Ich übernachtete mit meiner Reisegruppe für eine Nacht in diesem Hotel in der Hauptstadt Namibias am ersten Tag unserer Rundreise. Mein Zimmer befand sich in einem separaten Gebäude etwa 300 Meter vom Hoteleingang entfernt. Vor dem Zimmer befand sich direkt ein zum Zimmer zugehöriger PKW-Parkplatz. Die Zimmertür selbst ist eine einfache Holztür, welche nicht dicht und schallgeschützt ist. Somit konnten Ameisen in mein Zimmer laufen und waren überall auf dem Boden verteilt. Das Zimmer selbst ist wie in den 60er / 70er Jahren ausgestattet, mit einer Sitzecke, welche jedoch aufgrund der Sauberkeit leider nicht zum Verweilen einlädt. Auch der Tisch war nicht abgewischt und Krümel befanden sich noch darauf. Die Vorhänge wurden längere Zeit nicht gewaschen und die Stand-Klimaanlage habe ich lieber aus gelassen, da diese auch sehr verstaubt war. Das Zimmer selbst war schön groß und die Betten gut, habe gut geschlafen. Auf dem Zimmer befindet sich ein Rucksack-Fernseher mit zwei deutschen Sendern. Das Bad ist einfach ausgestattet mit einer älteren Duschkabine und dunklen Fliesen. WLAN ist nur im Hauptgebäude in der Lobby kostenfrei verfügbar. Das Frühstücksbuffet ist relativ überschaubar, Kaffee wird mit einer Haushalts-Kaffeemaschine für alle Gäste gekocht und nur auf Nachfrage gereicht. Die Säfte sind mit Wasser aus einem Sirup gemischt und richtig süß. Richtig satt bin ich leider nicht geworden zum Frühstück. Die Freundlichkeit der Mitarbeiter ist auch verbesserungsfähig. Für eine Nacht war es in Ordnung.

Name: Good for conferences or big groups
Review Content: I stayed at the Safari for five nights attending a conference and I found the overall experience very satisfactory. It is not my first time to Windhoek so I know that it has several good places to stay for a very reasonable price. Hence, the difference I see in the Safari is that it is well suited to what seems to be its two major group of clientele, conference participants and groups of tourists heading to or returning from the many tourist destinations in the country. Reception staff show a good degree of professionalism and courtesy but I think this behavior needs to be consistent. The girl who checked me in was actually quite aloof at first and was barely paying attention to me while I waited at the counter for nearly ten minutes to ask one simple question. This got me very angry and I was considering talking to management when this same girl responded to my requests very politely and in the most friendly manner just after about an hour. In terms of the amenities it is important to remember that the Safari actually is two hotels in one place. Apparently the Safari Court is the better one and costs slightly more than the Safari Hotel which is rather old and a bit cheaper. I stayed in the latter and all in all it is not bad. The most inconvenient thing about it for me was the key with its large key holder. I don't know how much it would cost to change to automatic digital locks from these old ones but I am sure it would make a lot of difference in improving the appeal of the hotel. If I were to decide not to stay at this place next time, it would certainly be because of the old locks and keys.  Food is not bad in the morning and for lunch when most things are fresh but the dinner menu seems to be taken out of the fridge and put on the buffet. The only consolation was that the standing chefs can make you great stir fried dish as you wait. Since you have choices between beef, chicken and game or even plain vegetarian this I think is the best bet. One other inconvenience I think may put off many people is the difficult internet connection. It rarely works in the rooms so you have to go to the lobby if you want to get a connection and even then it can be quite unreliable as the speed goes up and down frequently. Oh and one other thing. The room services. Dont try the room service unless you are desperately tired. It could take them anything between forty five minutes and an hour if at all they remember to come. I was equally disappointed when I was told that I can not get an iron and iron board to press my shirts for my meeting in the morning. What is more, they charge 3 USD if you want your shirt pressed (double if it is urgent). This, I think is totally unacceptable for a conference venue whose main clients are meeting participants that are very likely to need such a service. I believe it is wrong if the hotel is trying to make money out of such services. So in general my stay at the Safari was pleasant but not really outstanding. Would I stay here again? Only if I am attending a meeting there. Otherwise I am sure there are other equally good places in the city center.

Name: Der absoulte Top Urlaub
Review Content: Das Camp ist hervorragend, die achteckigen Zelte sind bestens ausgestattet. Hier gibt es einen fest gemauerten Waschtisch und gemauerte und getrennte DU und WC. Steckdosen, Schreibtisch, Moskitonetz, Terasse mit 2 Stühlen und Öllampe. Im Zelt gibt es eine Taschenlampe (da ab ca. 23. 00 Uhr-05. 00 Uhr kein Strom!) und eine Trillerpfeife für Notfälle. Außerdem gibt es einen Klingelknopf, damit man bei Dunkelheit und für Gepäckservice einen Massai rufen kann, dieser bringt die Gäste sicher zum Hauptgebäude. Das Camp ist unter deutscher Leitung, der Service ist super. Das Restaurant bot abends ein 4Gang Wahlmenue von sehr guter Qualität, das Frühstücksbuffet war umfangreich und ebenfalls sehr gut. Es gibt auch richtige Zimmer in Bungalows und neuerdings einen Pool mit Wellnessbereich. All dies ist direkt in der Wildnis (Steppe), ohne Zaun direkt neben den Warzenschweinen, Impalas und Erdhörnchen.

Name: A Namibian Jem
Review Content: I stayed one night at the Safari hotel , the next day I had a flight in a  small fixed wing plane to a dust runway in the middle of no where then I flew by helicopter for 1hour over the world famous "skeleton desert " to the offshore rig I was working on but that's another story .The Safari hotel is a nice complex I was living in a chalet type room, the room was clean , but after my epic flight from Spain to Paris , then a 10 1/2 hour over night flight to Joburg  , then a short flight to Namibia to Windhoek , then a 2 hour drive to the Safari hotel all I wanted was a shower and a change of clothes .Arriving at the hotel reception the formalities were very quick and the staff very professional .There was a big pool and bar at the Safari hotel side , a short walk over to Safari Court there they also have a pool and a gym.Everywhere is clean and tidy and the staff are always busy all over the safari complex .A couple of minors issues , I was given a wifi Internet code ticket but this was for only 2 hours after that you have to pay for more time .....WHY on 2 hours ?I was getting picked up the next morning so I asked reception to give me a early morning call at 6am , I didn't need the early call because a group of people leaving to go on a early morning Safari woke me up at 4am they had no consideration of others sleeping they were talking loudly with each other and on their mobile phones - this issue I discussed with reception during my checking out , they said they would pass on my concerns to their manager .But I don't want to be all doom and gloom , I would have liked to have stayed longer and the thought of going on a safari would have been a dream come true .The safari complex is well run , clean and good value for money  - there is a restaurant but I had a small meal sent to my room so I could watch the football on the TV  .There is a bar in the reception building and there are bars outside by the pool , the hotel has a free shuttle bus service for people who want to go to a near by shopping mall and Windhoek city centre .For the short time I was here I did enjoy my stay over the past 6 months I have stayed in hotels in 6 African countries and the Safari Hotel is by far the best , so well done to all the managers and staff  keep up the the excellent work you are doing and you never know maybe I will come back with my family for a Safari holiday .,,Thank you again and Good luck

Name: Nice hotel if you don't want to be in the city centre
Review Content: I stayed here for one night at the end of a group tour. The complex is nice and the pool is a good place to relax after a busy schedule. There was a good selection of food at breakfast. Housekeeping were very efficient but the bar service slow - quite often there was no-one there during opening hours. Like a lot of Namibia, there seemed to be more staff than guests. I didn't use the free shuttle but it's a good idea as the city centre is quite far away. Be careful when getting a taxi to the airport - I was told by the hotel the price would be 200 dollars, when I came to pay the taxi driver told me it was 280 and friends of mine paid 200 each (400 dollars for the taxi).

Name: Maybe the worst hotel I have ever been in
Review Content: After 2 amazing weeks in Namibia we arrived at the Safari Hotel and I was so disappointed. The rooms are very dreary, beds were dirty, view on the local airport which is right next door, broken toilet seats, etc. In the first night I woke up, standing in bed because of shock as my tab automized itself and the warm water started to run with an unbelievable loud noise. As this started I was awake because I couldn't turn of the water anymore and the noise continued hours and I needed to let the water run for hours and that in Africa. I complained several times at the reception and nothing happened. At 11am the plumber showed finally up and repaired it. No "sorry for the inconvenience " or similar I heard from the personnel. I always put the "do not disturb" on the door as I don't need room service for just two nights, but they still entered the room several times which is not acceptable, especially because the safe didn't work. Breakfast was like a mass processing: food not good, cold or empty - some people of my travel group had stomach problems after the breakfast. And the breakfast room is old and dirty as well. The pool area was also dirty. People had lunch there and 2 hours after they finished somebody came to remov eplates and cutlery which meant that several animals came to eat leftovers and the wind also moved cans within the pool area. Water was dirty as well so that nobody could take a swim.

Name: Disappointing

We were allocated a room amongst a very noisy tour group and when we complained about the noise we were "upgraded" to a so-called business class room. There was no hot water and the room was filthy. The noise level in this block was even worse and we had to call reception to send security to sort out the neighbours. We complained about the lack of cleanliness but nothing was done. General upkeep is poor, frayed wires on the kettle, stains on the carpets...... We attempted room service once to obtain some milk but were told that the chef had gone off duty so they couldnt help us!! The only saving grace is the staff who on the whole were extremely friendly, especially those working at the Conference Centre. I will definitely make use of the conference facilities again but will choose alternate accommodation.

Name: niemals 3 Sterne

Leider waren beide Erfahrungen ungenügend. Die Zimmer sind schmuddelig, sehr alt und die Klimaanlage verursacht einen Heidenlärm. Die Angestellten sind nicht wirklich hilfsbereit. Das Frühstück sollte um 6:30 losgehen. Wir mussten früh los für unsere Safari. Um halb sieben war der Raum noch verschlossen und als dieser geöffnet wurde, ging es noch etwa eine viertel Stunde, bis Gläser für O-Saft, Brot, der Toastapparat usw. am Buffet aufgetischt wurden. Ich kann das Safari Hotel niemandem mit gutem Gewissen empfehlen. Ich bin überzeugt, dass es in Windhoek viel Besseres für viel weniger Geld gibt.

Name: No me gustó
Review Content: La última noche en Namibia nos alojamos en este hotel, menos mal que sólo fue una noche porque no me gustó nada. No hay que confundirlo con el Hotel Court Safari que está en el mismo complejo y es más lujoso (al menos la zona de recepción). Cuando llegamos a la recepción del Court Safari creíamos que nuestro habitación estaría en este edificio, pero está en el edificio de al lado mucho más viejo y desencantado. La habitación que nos asignaron al principio tenía lo que parecía la puerta forzada y el marco un poco descacarillado, así que no nos dio ninguna confianza y bajamos a pedir un cambio, que por suerte nos dieron sin problemas. La habitación que nos asignaron de segundas era amplia, con dos camas, televisión y baño. Cuando subimos en el pasillo había un montón de camas plegadas por allí en medio, parecía que lo estaban desmantelando, y no se veía a nadie por allí que estuviera moviéndolas.A mí personalmente no me gustó el hotel porque me hacía sentir incómoda, me daba la sensación de que estábamos solos en un hotel con pasillos interminables tipo El Resplandor y después de ver la puerta de la primera habitación forzada, menos aún.Luego resultó que en la planta baja había alguna especie de excursión de estudiantes y eso me hice sentir más tranquila. El desayuno era bastante completo, se hacía en el restaurante que está en Hotel Court Safari, que por cierto, la información sobre horarios de comida que había en la habitación estaba equivocada porque cuando bajamos a cenar confiando en ese horario, resultó que el restaurante ya estaba cerrado.Un detalle que no me gustó tampoco es que el día que llegamos siendo ya mediodía, fuimos a comer algo al restaurante y no sé si es porque había un congreso, pero parecía que no querían vernos por allí y nos dieron una mesa en la terraza. Hubiéramos estado bien con vistas a la piscina y los jardines (zonas donde los huéspedes del Hotel Safari no pueden acceder) si no fuera porque había un viento terrible y no fueron capaces de decirnos si queríamos entrar pese a ello.En definitiva, no me gustó nada este hotel, me pareció descuidado y desangelado.

Name: Overpriced for average room
Review Content: I booked a standard room and received a room absolutely below standard. Dark but clean and more spacious. Unfortunately I couldn't watch tv at night as it made a horrible screeching noise. On my first night my neighbours were watching TV so loudly o could listen in on every word. In the morning I was rudely awoken by staff chatting outside my window at 7am. Breakfast was nothing special. On the second evening one of the light bulbs exploded. I called reception and explained what happened and asked for assistance in cleaning the glass pieces. For the rest of my stay I couldn't walk barefoot because there were glass pieces all over the floor. The internet is also terrible, it asked me to log in every other minute. Name: Ok rooom, average (boring?) food, poor wifi
Review Content: The room was ok (it was rather clean) but a tad too old. When it comes to the bathroom, it needs more cleaning (I found hair in the shower when I arrived). Also... the rooms are a bit "far" from the reception (approx. 5 minute walk), so it might be tricky if you travel with a lot of heavy suitcases. My room was too far from the main building to have wifi, so I had to go the reception or the swimming pool to have access to it (which was quite annoying).The food is boring and the service is really poor (I had to wait for more than 30 minutes to order my food a couple of times). The waiters are doing their best but they are clearly understaffed! The breakfast buffet is fine but again, it was quite a hassle to get tea as the waiters pour it for you (and since they're understaffed...). The swimming pool is ok, rather clean. Please note that the hotel is not in the city centre. So you need a cab to get there. The hotel offers a free shuttle service (twice an hour)... which stops at 2 pm on Saturdays!!!

Name: Safari Hotel - Windhoek
Review Content: Sometimes in life you discover a gem and need to share it with friends or fellow travellers. Well, the Safari Hotel in Windhoek is a Gem!We travelled from Swakopmund to Windhoek on gravel roads with our BMW 1200 Adventure motorcycles. This trip took most of the day as it is a tough route through various mountain passes. So by the time we arrived in Windhoek, we were tired, thirsty, hungry and in need of a shower, not to mention a decent room for the stopover.From the moment we rode into the magnificent complex, we were wowed! The security guard waved us in and saluted the men on their machines, welcoming us!The team at reception wasted no time is suggesting that we book two chalets for the night so that we can park our motorcycles under the carports right adjacent to our front door! The rates were reasonable at about NS 850/night/chalet. Checking in took 5 minutes, whilst we were ordering cold beers from the bar next door.Hotel complex consist of two hotels as well as chalet complex, all well maintained and spacious surrounds. Great breakfast by the way also included in our rate.Overall, a great experience and certainly staff that understands how to look after their customers. Management must take a compliment as well.Kind Regards Eugene

Name: Comfortable but a little out-dated
Review Content: This hotel is perfectly suitable for business people staying in Windhoek. It has everything you could need, bar, restaurant, wifi, comfortable rooms, transport, gym, etc. In general, the rooms are a little outdated and we had an issue as we were three, they put us in a room for two, but they were also kind enough to upgrade us to a room for four. Our breakfast was included, nice, no complaints. The fitness centre & spa was amazing! State of the art, brand new equipment and very professional staff - make sure to book for spa treatments. The staff were very friendly and helpful with finding safe transport to and from our dinner reservations. Would recommend to people staying in Windhoek on work/business trips or one-nighters.

Name: Etwas abseits, sonst ok
Review Content: Etwas außerhalb des Stadtzentrums gelegen, so dass man immer mit dem Taxi bzw. mit dem angebotenen Shuttleservice in die Stadt fahren muss. In der direkten Umgebung ist nicht viel los. Auf dem Hotelarenal sind mehrere Hotels untergebracht (3 und 4 Sterne Hotel). Zu Beginn unserer Reise durch das südliche Afrika haben wir im 3 sterne Hotel eine Nacht verbracht. Das Gelände ist weitläufig und so war es von der Rezeption zum Zimmer schon ein gutes Stück zu Fuß (etwa 5 Minuten). Das Zimmer selbst war nichts besonderes, aber sauber und komplett eingerichtet. gut gefallen hat uns der Poolbereich mit vielen Liegen. Das frühstück war recht englisch geprägt und nichts besonderes (Cornflakes und Toast gab es jedoch auch). Insgesamt für eine Nacht ganz ok, wenn man vorher aber in einer individuellen Lodge übernachtet hat sollte man nicht viel erwarten.

Name: Ok, aber das Personal könnte motivierter sein
Review Content: Das Hotel liegt etwa 45min mit dem Auto vom International Airport Windhoek entfernt und eher außerhalb des Stadtzentrums. Zu Fuß waren wir vom Hotel ins Stadtzentrum etwa 40min unterwegs.Die Anlage ist sehr groß und verfügt über ausreichend Parkplätze für Selbstfahrer.An der Hotelrezeption wurden wir freundlich begrüßt, jedoch wirkte das Hotelpersonal eher unmotiviert und träge.Die Zimmer waren sauber und ok, aber in die Jahre gekommen. Jedoch lief der Abfluss unserer Dusche und des Waschbeckens sehr langsam, müsste also mal wieder gereinigt werden. Ein Kühlschrank war vorhanden, dieser funktionierte aber auch nach dem drücken verschiedener Knöpfe und Stromschalter nicht. Nach unserer ersten Nacht funktionierte im ganzen Resort das Wasser nicht mehr. Wir sind also ohne Duschen ins Stadtzentrum zum Abendessen gefahren. Als wir wieder zurückkamen, stand unser ganzer Zimmerfußboden unter Wasser. Die Hotelrezeption reagierte schnell und gab uns ein neues Zimmer.Das Frühstück war ok und auch die Auswahl war soweit in Ordnung (frische Omeletts, süße Backwaren, verschiedene Aufschnitte, Eierspeisen, Porridge, Obst, warme Anteile wie Speck, Bohnen und Würstchen). Der Frühstücksraum war aber sehr kalt und auch eher spärlich besucht, also nach Hauptreisesaison sah das nicht aus. Wer einfache Ansprüche zum Übernachten hat, so wie wir, für den ist das Hotel Safari absolut ausreichend. Ein ATM ist im übrigen in der Hotellobby vorhanden.Punktabzug gab es für das unmotivierte Personal, die abgelebte Einrichtung und die eisigen Temperaturen im Frühstücksbereich.

Name: Scarsa gentilezza
Review Content: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per una notte in attesa dell'inizio del tour della Namibia. Personale poco competente e disponibile alla reception. Stanza spaziosa, ma abbastanza spartana e gelida. Tutt'altra cosa per l'hotel che fa parte dello stesso complesso, il Safari Court.  Comodo il servizio navetta per il centro e i due Mall. ...anche perché non c'è molto da fare a Windhoek . Assicuratevi con l'autista che venga a riprendervi, a noi infatti è successo di dover chiamare un taxi per rientrare in hotel. La scusa addotta è stata che il bus era pieno...mah...
Date: Date of stay: June 2017This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Worst stay ever
Review Content: I stayed there for 7 days over a two week period. 3 days one week, 4 days next. Firstly their rates changed when I tried to book the accommodation for the second week. Price changes by N$210 per night. When I pointed out that it will be from the same type of room I was fobbed off. The air-conditioner in the room makes a terrible noise , so you cannot run it at night during sleep time. The tv channels are very badly tunned-in and you cannot see the picture . The telephone in my room was not working and they never bothered to fix it. I had to call via cell to their switchboard to get any service. They want to save water but their toilets were constantly running water into the bowl, and not just a drip!! I could not use the wifi as the room is in a corner and there is no coverage.

Name: Excellent ending of holiday!
Review Content: We stayed only one night over at the hotel on our way back to South Africa.  It was very special, we lingered until almost dark in both the swimming pool and jacuzzi before eating out at the restaurant.  The food was good and the service the same.  As we had to leave very early, we got breakfast packs that could lasted for the whole day!  We will surely visit again!

Name: Schöne Bilder - die aber täuschen
Review Content: Entschuldigung, ich muss zu dieser Unterkunft mal schreiben.Wir waren auf Rundreise und im März hier untergebracht. Es war eine glatte Katastophe. Das Zimmer zwar groß, aber schmutzig, als wäre hier lange keiner gewesen - weder Gast noch Putzfrau. Hotelservice angerufen, es kam auch einer, der die Überdecke mitnahm, weil sie zwei große Pissflecken zeigte, was für eine Sauerei. Die Putzfrau kam wenig später und saugte die Bettvorleger, weil da Haare und andere Krümel drauflagen und säuberte den mit Schimmel besetzten Kühglschrank und die Flecken und Fettreste vom kleinen Glastisch. Furchtbar. Nach dieser Erfahrung  auch in Zimmern der Mitreisenden, besuchte keiner das Restaurant; alle aßen auswärts.Deshalb schwierig das Personal zu bewerten. Zum Glück waren wir nur eine Nacht in diesem Hotel. Von den drei Sternen ist mindestens einer zu viel.Also nicht von den schönen Bildern auf der Webseite täuschen lassen.Empfehlung: Was anderes suchen.
Date: Date of stay: March 2015This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: OMG Needs Help
Review Content: I stayed at the safari court for 3 days and it was shocking to see how paying guest are hosted there. I will start with the serving staff who are unfriendly, chew gum while serving u and are on their cell phones constantly while one wait on service. The chefs look as if they are lost not knowing what they are doing there.No creativity in dishes and most of the time not sure what they are serving you.Managers are nonexistence never there to assist. This place needs major help

Name: Primo impatto con la Namibia
Review Content: E' una struttura che ovviamente accoglie coloro che partono per i tours namibiani o che rientrano dagli stessi. Io e la mia amica avevamo una stanza enorme e un bagno grande. Cena e colazione nella norma, senza tante pretese ma ci siamo trovate bene. Direi nella norma pensando anche a dove si è...Poi si dorme solo e si riparte subito per le bellezze della Namibia o si rientra a casa.

Name: Could do better
Review Content: Standard rooms, as opposed to the business class, have very basic, old fashioned furniture and the noise from the adjoining bathrooms is terrible. Also if you are on the ground floor the noise of cars arriving and leaving, there is motel type parking, is bad in the evening and early morning.There is an annoying internet system that only allows you to sign in for 2 hours at a time. And the system is such that downloading email systems does not work a lot of the time - hopeless when staying there for business.

Name: Ottimo hotel completo di ogni servizio, vicino al centro città
Review Content: Ho soggiornato in questa location per 1 notte in tour Nomad come tappa finale prima di andare in aeroporto. Il complesso è molto grande, ma ben strutturato e organizzato. All’arrivo ci hanno accolti con un piccolo aperitivo,  consegnato le chiavi delle camere e portato le valige direttamente alla camera (facchini). Nella hall c’è il wifi free funzionante (anche nell’intero complesso/stanze ma il segnale è molto debole), un bar, la sala ristorante e la sala colazioni. Nella hall c’è anche un piccolo bancomat per poter prelevare contante in caso servisse. La camera assegnata era molto spaziosa, dotata di 2 letti e un divano, tv, frigobar e bagno. Il bagno era molto pulito, con doccia. All’interno di questo hotel, vi è anche un piccolo giardino con piscina, dove potersi rilassare un po dopo una giornata calda. La colazione l’ho trovata ottima, è a buffet, ottima la varietà di dolci e di salato da poter scegliere, inoltre si può effettuare richieste direttamente al cuoco. In conclusione, in questo posto mi sono trovato bene sia per l’accoglienza, sia per la posizione, sia per il livello generale dell’hotel.

Name: Start Hotel
Review Content: Durchschnittliches Stadthotel zum Start der Rundreise durch Namibia. Überlaufen Team so weit ok, aber sehr steril! Kann man buchen, muss man aber nicht! Bietet Shuttle für die Stadt, nur nicht am Wochenende.

Name: Für eine Nacht ok
Review Content: Das Safari Hotel war die erste Unterkunft in Namibia, bevor wir zur den Lodges fuhren. Das Gelände ist weitläufig, hat aber auf den ersten Blick weit bessere Zeiten gesehen, das Personal (bis auf den Concierge an der Rezeption) sehr nett und zuvorkommend. Ein bisschen gruselig war es für uns, da wir gleich nach der Ankunft gebrieft wurden (nicht in der Nacht unterwegs sein, außer mit einem ordentlichen Taxi...), unsere Hotelzimmertüre zwar geschlossen hat, aber es war ein mehr als fingerdicker Spalt zwischen dem Rahmen und der Türe (dafür alle Fenster mit massiven Gittern verhangen?!). Das Badezimmer war geräumig, man könnte ev. die Duschköpfe regelmäßig entkalken, dann hätten wir nicht den kompletten Raum unter Wasser gesetzt. ;) Wir haben am Ankunftstag im Hotel gegessen, leider waren weder die Chicken wings (deren Fleisch war fast schwarz?), noch der Backfisch wirklich genießbar. Das Frühstücksbuffet war hingegen wirklich umfangreich und ganz frisch. Wir haben eine weitere Nacht dort verbracht (Abreise), beim neu zugewiesenen Zimmer war zwar kein Spalt bei der Türe, allerdings war die Badezimmer- und Duschtüre so eigenartig zueinander angebracht, dass wir Schwierigkeiten hatten die Türen wieder zu entkeilen. Für die An- und Abreise ist es ok, mehr als das ist nicht zu empfehlen.
Date: Date of stay: September 2018This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Excellent events venue
Review Content: We attended the 5th ICT summit at this venue and the capacity was sufficient. One counted about 500 people in attendance. With additional rooms for break away sessions, this hotel is ideal to host big Government conferences and product launches. Their accommodation is also excellent and even better for the logistics and planning team.

Name: Very disappointing
Review Content: The reception area is very lavish,however the rooms are in a very poor condition. Upon reporting the matter to hotel management the response was that my vehicle's hubcaps going missing is still nothing because crime is the norm in the area because using the parking is at own risk with no CCTV cameras present or even guards patrolling the area.

Name: Nichts besonderes, für Windhoek ok!
Review Content: Das Hotel ist sehr unpersönlich, da sehr viele Zimmer vorhanden sind. Die Zimmer waren sauber und mit einem Kühlschrank und Pflegeprodukte ausgestattet. Es ist jedoch recht dunkel in dem Zimmer.Direkt neben dem Hotel liegt ein regionaler Flughafen, deshalb ist es zeitweise sehr laut.Das Frühstück war reichlich und auch lecker. Der Personal im Frühstücksraum jedoch unfreundlich.WLAN-Codes mit 500 MB sind gegen Gebühr erhältlich.Der Pool sah nicht sauber aus und lädt nicht zum Schwimmen ein. Außerdem lebt im Pool eine Wasserschildkröte, wer also Schwimmen möchte, bitte vorsichtig sein :-)Es wird ein kostenloser Shuttle in die Stadt angeboten, der relativ pünktlich ist.

Name: Pleasant stay

Name: Good hotel, quite centrally located
Review Content: We got a big family room with four beds next to each other, fridge and air conditioner. We got a welcome drink and had complimentary water in the room. TV (working badly), free wifi, which worked in the room, laundry service. Pool, free pool towels and plenty of sun deck chairs. Kids were very happy. Would have liked to spend more than one night and visit Windhoek and relax/unwind here instead of traveling to the Okavango Delta the next day. We had dinner at the restaurant of the Safari Court and breakfast at the Safari Hotel. The dinner was a lovely buffet for 290 Namibian dollars, including dessert. The breakfast buffet is great with a lot of variety, including crêpes, pancakes, cereal, bread and rolls, hot dishes, fruit salad and much more.

Name: Business/group hotel in Windhoek
Review Content: Good for a city stay. The 4 star Safari court is much better (rooms, food) but the 3-star Safari hotel is alright but not as comfortable as the 4 star one.Very busy hotel. Buffet in Welwitschia restaurant could be improved. Very good in Acacia restaurant (Safari court). Beautiful settings in Acacia (outside as well).

Name: Non convince
Review Content: Sono stata in questo hotel due notti, non consecutive, all'inizio e alla fine del tour in Namibia. Le camere sono spaziose e letti quasi queen size. Ci hanno messo nella struttura con "suite" alle spalle dell'entrata dell'hotel. Le stanze non sono molto isolate fra loro. Il bagno, in entrambi i casi, di dimensioni ridotte e con qualche problema per la poca manutenzione. Impossibile capire il funzionamento della doccia: o si gela o ci si scotta. Abbiamo provato anche il buffet della cena: non male; alza il punteggio della recensione.Il personale è cordiale, ma non sempre veloce nel risolvere i problemi (ho aspettato per quasi un giorno una saponetta per il bagno, che alla fine non è arrivata).Hanno un servizio navetta compreso per raggiungere il centro città e i due centri commerciali più grandi di Windhoek.Il wifi funziona bene nella hall, mentre, come spesso accade, nelle stanze è lento e spesso la copertura se ne va.
Date: Date of stay: August 2016This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Review Content: I booked my air ticket and hotel accommodation on Orbitz.com and had a selection of rooms at this facility. I chose a Business room with one double bed. Review Content: The location was good & the staff very helpful. The room had all the amenities & mini bar fridge. The beds were very comfortable .The breakfast was average but adequate.  All in all its not a bad place to stay for business purposes.
