Name: Простой, но вполне приличный  отель за небольшие деньги.
Review Content: Отель не новый, но в  номерах есть всё необходимое, для того, чтобы отдохнуть после длительного перелёта, они  простенькие, чистенькие  и достаточно просторные.  Можно  освежиться в бассейне, он, можно сказать, большой, но вода в апреле немного бодрит и с хлоркой, по-моему, перестарались. Есть возможность отдохнуть в шезлонгах на поляне перед бассейном, там же есть бар на свежем воздухе. Приятно удивил завтрак.  Вкусно (особенно неплоха была печеночка), разнообразно, голодным никто не ушёл.  Приветливый персонал.

Review Content: Les chambres sont spacieuses et convenables, mais la restauration et le service sont nuls. On peut attendre 1h avant d'être servi pour un simple sandwich.Le buffet est fermé le midi...L'internet avec le Wifi est trèèèèèèèèèèèèèès lent...

Name: Staff need some hospitality training
Review Content: Booked at the last minute, reception staff were pleasant apart from one young lady, who twice put the phone down on someone in a rude manner.  The rooms look jaded but worked.  The food at the Bar Terrace, was very nice and good value for money, pity the waiter who served us both nights was on a different planet, and had the same stained clothing on as the night previous.  Service is slow, 45 minutes to get an Irish Coffee, ordered whilst we still had our main course plates in front of us, is just a little too long to wait......... But there were two other tables of, two and five people that might have been the hold up.  Management should check their staff occasionally and not just rely on conferences to keep them ticking over.

Name: Decent Place, No Great Shakes but perfectly Okay
Review Content: Okay, well the first thing i have to say is that Windhoek must have some pretty good hotels...at the time of writing this hotel was ranked 17 out or 17 hotels in town.Now if I read that before my trip i would have been quaking in my boots coming to stay here as part of my G Adventure. It is by no means a plush pad but my God, it does not deserve to be ranked as the worst hotel in the city!The rooms are a bit tired and drab, but they were clean and spacious. The hotel pool was really nice and the breakfast was absolutely excellent. The staff were so helpful and the wifi was both free and quick. They have a god business centre which was free of charge and they offer a free shuttle to downtown Windhoek.As long as you do not expect too much, the Safari will do you just fine, I simply cannot believe its poor ranking. i would have no problem whatsoever in staying here again and have no problem in recommending this place.
Date: Date of stay: July 2013This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Very average
Review Content: I have stayed twice for several days in the last year. The first time was in the motel style rooms, which were pretty much tatty 70's vintage decor (no, not by design, the real thing!). This time I booked into the business rooms and found the rooms again to be below par. Forget sleeping with the aircon on, it sounds like a bulldozer idling outside your window....and in 40 degree celcius temperatures, an aircon might be useful. The internet didn't work in the rooms (try 8 minutes to open an email without attachments), the toilet pipe leaked on the bathroom floor and the coffee is positively insipid. That said, it is convenient, but there are many bnb's in town which are a far better quality stay... for the same money -  try the Elegant Guesthouse or the Olive Grove, both great places to stay.
Date: Date of stay: February 2012This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: Nice place but far from the city
Review Content: I was travelling for business and the hotel was selected by my hosts (corporate rate 622 N$ for single occupancy). My first impression was not good, it looks rather old fashioned and worn, but after a few days, I came to appreciate the cosiness of it all.Rooms are spacious with large bathroom (shower only), all kept very clean, but also somewhat worn out. Old TV-set with some channels in poor quality (there are many channels, so you can always find something), phone with loose wires and a Wifi that does not work in the far away rooms (like no. 19). Btw. to get wifi you must obtain a license key in reception, which will give you 2 hours of connection. Free service, but somewhat cumbersome.The kitchen will serve you round the clock, with buffets in the morning and evenings (for evenings you change to a la carte after one trial of the buffet). Prices are fair (but high when compared to Windhoek restaurants). Nice pool area, garden, kids playground and terrace. And the beer is nice (try Windhoek Lager).Drawback is the location next to the old Windhoek Airport, and hence 5 km from the city centre. A free shuttle will take you there in daytime (and to a local shopping mall), so will cabs, but it is outside the city itself.All in all a nice stay for one week, with helpful staff and reasonable setting. Next time I will ask for something closer to the city though.
Date: Date of stay: June 2010This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Name: A Good choice for business trip to Windhoek
Review Content: Stayed in a business room for 3 nights. Room was large and clean with a good size bathroom with bath. Generally everything of a good standard, although there was rip in the net curtains, a broken bin lid and the large key ring and stiff lock made getting into the room a bit of a noisy struggle.Bought internet cards from reception which worked in the room, although fairly slow and did not always log off correctly wasting paid minutes.Reasonable pool, but water heavy with chemical and no shade for the loungers, although there are tables and chairs under thatched open-sided “huts”.Staff friendly and very helpful, but generally slower waiter service than in the US or Europe.Breakfast buffet style with reasonable hot choice, but no fresh fruit and limited selection of cold meats and cheese.Taxis easily arranged by reception into town.

Name: Struttura datata

Colazione a buffet media. Lontano dal centro ma con shuttle ad orari prestabiliti. Personale non particolarmente cortese. WiFi solo in reception. Credo ci sia di meglio!

Name: Für eine Nacht ok, netter Pool

Name: First, but not last, trip to Africa
Review Content: We stayed at the Safari for a bit over two weeks on a combination business and sightseeing trip.  First off, it should be made clear that there are two separate hotels on this property, the Safari and the Safari Court.  We stayed at the Safari, an older, bigger facility.  The Safari Court is a much newer hotel.  There is a large conference center served by both hotels.  Our room, in the Safari, was quite large by today's standards with a refrigerator, TV, and the usual hot water pot and coffee makings.  The air conditioning was more than adequate.  The room was provided with a small, west facing balcony that looked onto a small citrus grove.  It was classified as a business room.While this hotel is an older property, we were very comfortable.  The room service was prompt, friendly and helpful.  The hotel provide shuttle was convenient and runs all day.  The driver was able to accommodate our requests for short side trips.  One afternoon, there were some significant issues with the water supply but those issues were quickly resolved.  There is also, occasionally, significant noise from the nearby airport.  I would stress to anyone planning a visit to Namibia anticipating staying at this property:  THIS IS NOT YOUR GRANDFATHER'S HILTON!.  It is a comfortable, somewhat rustic, more than suitable base for touring the area of central and coastal Namibia.  It is NOT a resort hotel.  The food is reasonably good with an extensive, somewhat regionalized menu and the Welwitschia Restaurant was uniformly good.  Service, without exception, was outstanding.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and we will visit again and we will stay at this property.  Namibia is a fascinating country; Africa as were want to remember it from our childhood stories.  To have recovered from the conflicts of only 25 years ago is remarkable and the government of Namibia is to be congratulated for they have accomplished.

Name: Functional but in need of improvements
Review Content: IMPORTANT  TO KNOW:  the "Safari Hotel" (three stars), the "Safari Court" (four stars), and the "Safari Conference Center" are all located next to each other in the same property and have access to pretty much the same restaurants and services.  This means that choosing between the two hotels is an issue of how much you want to pay for your room.  LOCATION: The facilities are right next to the old airport, which I think now serves as the poinf of departure for the domestic flights (absolutely no noise in case you wonder).  The international airport is about 45 minutes away from the Hotel and Windhoek.  Coming back to the hotel, it is in the outskirts of Windhoek, but it is a small city and they do have a free shuttle that goes down town and to a shopping center.   Windhoek itself is pretty organized and clean, a fact that took me by surprise.   If you take a taxi, make sure to ask what the total fare is BEFORE departing (I took a hotel taxi with three people; the driver said it was NAD 50 for the ride, but then claimed at the end that it was NAD 50 per person!  We refused to pay him ).   THE ROOM:  I staid in the executive rooms of the Safari Hotel (three stars) which was perfectly clean, but it did feel a bit tired (e.g. the toilet lid had lost a bit of paint).  On the other hand, hotel is safe and the room will accomodate you well.  I read a review saying there were no elevators, but there were two of them in my area.  Another review spoke about cigarrette smell.  I am quite sensitive to it, but I don't think it would be a problem for most (they seemed to ventilate all rooms everyday).  I do not know if the situation is different in other parts of the hotel.Four things I would suggest the management to fix or improve are:  1) the minibar fridge is old, which means it's a bit noisy.  I am not particularly sensitive to noise, but I am sure this would probably be a problem for some.  2) the rooms lack a safe box.  They have a centralized safe in the reception, but it's not convenient at all to be going back and forth to get  them if you constantly need them (i.e. a laptop!) 3) The rooms also lack an ironing board, which means you depend on the hotel for pressing.  This is probably not an issue if you go on holidays, but if you are there for business it's not nice to have to guess whether your shirt will be ready on time for the next day's meeting.4) the key chain they give you can only be described as the biggest key chain in the world!  It's a huge piece of plastic that is about a third of a letter size page.  Where are you supposed to keep it?FOOD:  It's pretty standard and on the expensive side.  Other reviewers considered it was "terrible", but I did not find that to be the case.  On the other hand, if you want a fancy dinner then better go to a restaurant in Windhoek (Joe's Beer House is a fantastic experience!).  The breakfast buffet was also standard, but lacked fruit.

Name: +-2 years of pleasant visits ended today by a “strict” Manager
Review Content: Today ended somewhat disappointing when we were told that only Hotel Guests may use the pool 🙈, by a “new” manager, assuming also he’s not a Namibian/local. Okay, ...I do agree that Hotel Pools are for guests only, and things can get out of hand when not controlled, but I behave myself, I enjoyed the Island Vacation feeling every time I visited the Hotel pool, I actually made sure about 2 years ago the Reception knew about what my plans were: they accepted and let me feel very welcome.We spent quite a bit on food and drinks next to the pool, regularly, and were given very good service by the very friendly staff. They made us feel welcome.Unfortunately this seemed to be my last visit to the hotel which broke our hearts, as a Manager decided it doesn’t suit!Visiting many Hotels and Guest Houses over a time period of many years, this was the most unwelcome feeling I ever felt. Well, to the staff of the Hotel Safari pool area: thanks for a very good time I had with you guys and girls, thanks for always serving us promptly and for your friendliness, the good food, the beers on hot summer days next to the pool. Thanks also to the staff at reception, all of you made us feel very welcome.Me and my family, and sometimes a friend joining us, will remember this. Unfortunately I cannot say this for the Manager whom I tried to explain this to. Is he Namibian??? He seemed quite irritated, blunt and demanding.I’ll probably never visit, nor propose the Hotel to anyone in future again: where does ons draw the line??? Competition is fierce in this low economic cycle experienced in Namibia: shouldn’t (Namibian) consumers be feeling welcome while spending buckets of money in Namibian Dollars, or are International visitors, with US$, the only focus. Other Namibian Hotels do the contrary! Even at their pool areas.Fortunately I travelled a lot and know what it is to be served and feeling welcome or at home.Therefore the reason for my low rating! The Rest is 4-5 out of 5!!!

Name: Le safari Court Hotel
Review Content: Arrivé à Windhoek, le 10/08Salut les amis. Cela fait un long moment que vous n’avez pas de mes nouvelles. Je voyage, mais je n’ai pas eu d’expériences à partager sérieusement avec vous car en famille, on est un peu bridé. Là, je me suis échappé. Je suis à Windhoek, Namibie et au Safari court Hôtel ; il  y a aussi le safari hôtel (la différence ?, j’ai pris de mauvaises habitudes). Peu importe, choisissez ce qui vous convient en fonction de votre budget (les deux Hôtels sont dans la même concession).  J’aime le restaurant du Safari Court. Ses crudités à la plancha m’ont fait adoré le self-service, auquel j’étais allergique (je vous ai dit, j’ai de mauvaises habitudes). En tout état de cause je vous laisse vous balader. La nourriture  souvent à la frenchy et si vous demandez un Chardonay, ne vous y méprenez pas (bien parfumé), il est du voisin Sud-Africain. Ces Français !, il faut qu’ils laissent leurs traces partout…Cet hôtel offre une navette (toutes les heures) à destination des Centres Commerciaux et des places actives en ville (20 minutes avec les feux)Après, je vous parlerai de Okapuka Ranch, où vous pouvez voir les animaux dans leur environnement naturel… A suivre

Name: Hôtel moyen
Review Content: Chambre correcte de taille moyenne et propre. Bonne literie, salle de bains assez spacieuse. Les dîners sont servis sous forme de buffets et le choix assez varié. Par contre les petits déjeuners sont assez limités dans le choix. Hôtel loin de tous commerces.

Name: Clean hotel, friendly dtaff
Review Content: Stayed for almost a week here for a workshop. It's a nice friendly hotel with decent rooms, food and facilities. However, there were multiple problems with services including billing, getting called at 4am (twice) for a wake up call when I hadn't asked for it and with cleaning services. Overall a nice atmosphere with a great shuttle service into town every hour and helpful staff.

Name: A good hotel to rest after a very long flight
Review Content: We arrived after a flight that took us stopping over in Addis Abba and Johannesburg so it took about 22 hours to arrive. We were exhausted and only wanted a showr and get to sleep. The rooms were comfortable clean. Hot water was available. In the morning we had a very good breakfast and had recuperate to start to arrange for our traveling.  The rooms just like any other international hotel. The lobby had an African feel to it. The staff was kind and helpfully.

Name: Oude bende en heel vies
Review Content: Het hoofdgebouw waar je incheckt en waar het ontbijt is, is mooi. Eerste indruk is dan ook positief. Tot je de deur van je kamer opent. Oude troep, meubels zijn kapot, alles is smerig, de dode insecten liggen zelfs op en om het bed, afval van de vorige gasten lag er nog, badkamer compleet beschimmeld. Kortom: een schande. Klagen heeft geen zin, ze doen niets. Dit was ons laatste nachtje voor vertrek naar huis, heel jammer.

Name: Gutes Stadthotel
Review Content: Wir waren zum Anfang unserer Nambia und Botswana Rundreise dort und haben eine Nacht im Hotel verbracht. Die Zimmer sind zweckmäßig und etwas abgewohnt, jedoch sehr sauber. Die Einrichtung ist recht altmodisch. Das Zimmer verfügt über recht gut funktionierendes Wlan und TV mit ZDF-Empfang. Die Nächte werden zu dieser Jahreszeit recht kühl in Namibia und deswegen waren wir sehr froh über eine funktionierende  Heizung. Das Frühstück und das Dinnerbuffet empfanden wir als besonders gut, auch wenn es seinen Preis hat. Das Personal war ausgesprochen freundlich und zuvorkommend. Für eine Nacht können wir dieses Hotel bedenkenlos empfehlen. TIP: Wer das wahre Leben in Windhoek erleben will, bucht eine Stadtrundfahrt bei Face2Face nach Katutura.

Name: Average for Windhoek
Review Content: My room had a bit of a run-down feel to it, with corners of walls being chipped and needing paint, old carpets, the flower pattern bed spreads were straight from the seventies. The linen on the bed was threadbare with tears in them. The TV - lets move to flat-screen please. Beds were comfortable though and there were more than enough power outlets.Services were not much better.No wi-fi reception in the rooms. No water provided except on day of arrival. Thereafter water would not be replaced in the room. The only option to obtain water is to then purchase a 1 L from the restaurant at N$ 26!Two good aspects were reception staff that were friendly and efficient. The wi-fi was also OK in the restaurant.Meals were a mixed bag. Dinner buffet not too bad, although a bit pricey at N$189. Waiters were very friendly though. Breakfast was just plain poor. I stayed for 5 nights  and not once was I able to get an omelette made. Only once did they manage to make me fresh fried eggs - this was the only morning that the flat-top was actually switched on.(still could not do an omelette though). The rest of the time you only had a choice of pre-cooked scrambled. Breakfast opens at 06:30, but they were never on time.Location I found good, being close to shops, major roads and local airport. Security was also sufficient.In summary - good location, friendly staff. However poor food, wifi in rooms and general outdated feeling brought it down. All in all not terrible, but at the price not good value.

Review Content: Roomy and excellent if sharing so much space. Clean, had a a shower drain issue but it was sorted out in time. Great buffet dinner and breakfast and I loved the onsite coffee shop. Name: Valido solo per una notte
Review Content: Io e mio marito abbiamo soggiornato qui il primo e l'ultimo giorno del nostro viaggio in Namibia, l'hotel è molto grande le stanze sono grandine e i letti comodi...la stanza non é il massimo della pulizia il bello é che nel resto del paese abbiamo trovato i bagni pulitissimi quasi dappertutto! Abbiamo cenato due volte al ristorante dell'hotel il cibo non é male sicuramente la carne é molto buona...la colazione non è male ma ho trovato di meglio altrove...il personale non si sforza più di tanto ad essere simpatico e gentile...insomma se dovete stare una notte va bene ma di più lo sconsiglio!

Name: only okay!
Review Content: We had booked for the Safari Court Hotel, but when we arrived we were put into the Safari Hotel (same complex just older and across the car park).  The invoice is misleading as it has both names at the top of the invoice, so just double check and make sure which one you are in.  Our rooms were very very  large, and good enough, but looked like we were checking into a council block.  For some reason they put us right at the end near the staff quarters!!  So perfectly plain and adequate, but it wasnt what I was expecting.   The hotel is large and a bit souless.  Probably just too big and not enough people. During the day we used the pool at the Safari Court Hotel, which is lovely.  The bar however, is better at the Safari Hotel across the car park.  If they could take bits of both hotels and put them together the place would be much better.    My least favourite hotel this holiday to Namibia.

Name: Decent Place to Stay
Review Content: Like another reviewer mentioned, there are two properties. My review addresses the older, more basic accomodations. I spent two nights here before beginning a trip through Namibia. My biggest complaint about the room is that the A/C [very nice to have] was SO loud that it woke me up whenever it went on. Otherwise, the room was good enough for a brief stay. Staff were friendly, but not always helpful. I thought the restaurant meals were fine. The property does offer wifi [ask for code at desk], but sometimes they are out of codes. There is a shuttle [limited hours] available if you want to go into town.

Name: Much Better than Expected
Review Content: We had read some poor reviews about this hotel but were totally surprised when we got there.In total we spent three nights in Safari used the pool, bar and restaurant.We had two excellent and really large double rooms with en suite bath/Shower. The rooms were clean and had everything you might want including a fridge (not a minibar).Service was extremely friendly and efficient.The Restaurant staff were very friendly - especially to out two kids (13 and 10). Breakfast and evening buffet were excellent. Well presented and a good selection including local game in the evening.There had been reports that the hotel was loud, but this was certainly not the case. One can here the planes in the nearby eros airport but we did not find them loud enough to be disturbing - even though we live and are accustomed to quiet countryside.The little souvenir shop was adequate and the staff extremely helpful.The pool ,was spotless, but a little cold. We were almost alone in the afternoon and the kids loved it including the cake shop right next to the swimming area.The bar and staff were very pleasant, only nuisance were a couple of rather loud africans watching basketball on TV. They don't make cocktails, but they will get you a burger or french fries if you are feeling hungry. All in all very good.What more can one say: we would stay there again if we ever go to Windhoek again.
